Pre-Game Insights: Phil Salt will step up as captain in place of Jos Buttler, who is out with a hamstring injury.
Phil Salt will become the first Welsh-born cricketer to lead an international England side on Welsh soil when he takes on Australia in Cardiff on Friday.
Marcus Trescothick is standing in as coach until Brendon McCullum expands his role to include the two white-ball formats from January.
The series against Australia could be key in determining who stays in the mix for the England white-ball team.
England underperformed at the T20 World Cup earlier this year and last year they flopped when defending their ODI World Cup, so all eyes are on whether the side have made drastic improvements.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The final and potentially deciding match of the ODI series will take place at Gloucestershire’s Seat Unique Stadium in Bristol, which has faced controversy over its hybrid pitch.
Gloucestershire will host a 'hybrid pitch walkthrough' to counteract claims that their surface isn’t up to hosting internationals.
